[[lipophobicity|Oleophobic display coating]] | sar = | hac = | references = {{cite web|url=http://www.google.com/nexus/#/tech-specs |title=Galaxy Nexus |publisher=Google.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-22}}{{cite web|url=http://www.samsung.com/uk/consumer/mobile-devices/smartphones/android/GT-I9250TSAXEU-spec |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus - Android 4. 0 Smartphone - SAMSUNG UK |publisher=Samsung.com |date=2011-09-19 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}{{cite web |url=http://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_google_galaxy_nexus_i9250-4219.php |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus â Full phone specifications |publisher=Gsmarena.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}{{cite web |url=http://phandroid.com/2011/10/18/official-galaxy-nexus-specs-revealed/ |title=Official Galaxy Nexus Specs Revealed |publisher=Phandroid.com |date=2011-10-18 |accessdate=2011-10-27}} }} The '''Galaxy Nexus''' is a [[touchscreen]] [[slate phone|slate]] [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[smartphone]] developed by a partnership between [[Samsung]] and [[Google]].{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}} The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}} It is the third generation successor to Googleâs previous flagship phones, the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]]. It has a curved HD (1280Ã720 pixels)[http://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_nexus-4219.php Samsung Galaxy Nexus â Full phone specifications]. Gsmarena.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. [[Super AMOLED]] display, an improved camera system, and Googleâs new version of its Android operating system, version [[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|4.0, codenamed ''Ice Cream Sandwich'']].{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsungs-galaxy-nexus-gets-official-android-4-0-4-65-inch-hd|title=Samsung's Galaxy Nexus gets official: Android 4.0, 4.65-inch HD Super AMOLED display (video)|publisher=[[Engadget]]|date=October 18, 2011}} The name is the result of [[co-branding]] between the ''[[Samsung Galaxy]]'' and ''[[Google Nexus]]'' brands of Android smartphones. The Galaxy Nexus was unveiled at Google and Samsung's ''Ice Cream Sandwich'' event on 19 October, 2011 in [[Hong Kong]]. It was released on November 17, 2011.http://venturebeat.com/2011/11/17/samsung-galaxy-nexus-now-available-in-uk-but-still-no-word-on-us-launch/ == History == [[File:Galaxy Nexus hands-on.jpg|thumb|left|Galaxy Nexus hands-on after announcement in [[Soho, Hong Kong]].]] Google's plans to continue the [[Google Nexus|Nexus brand]] and bring a third-generation Nexus to market were confirmed by Google's senior vice president of mobile platforms [[Andy Rubin]] in May 2011.[http://www.techradar.com/news/phone-and-communications/mobile-phones/google-confirms-there-will-be-a-nexus-3-954535 Google confirms there will be a Nexus 3] [[Samsung Telecommunications|Samsung mobile]] put out a teaser video[http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=oM9RO-GAKjE YouTube: SAMSUNG Mobile Unpacked 2011 - Google Episode Teaser Video] for its "Google Episode" of Unpacked on October 11th[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/05/samsung-teases-next-weeks-unpacked-offers-a-momentary-glance/ Samsung teases next week's 'Unpacked,' offers a momentary glance at a mysterious device] but later postponed (to the 19th of October[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/13/samsung-confirms-ice-cream-sandwich-event-on-october-19/ Engadget: Samsung confirms Ice Cream Sandwich event on October 19]) the product announcement[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/07/samsung-and-google-postpone-ice-cream-sandwich-and-galaxy-nexus/ Samsung and Google postpone Ice Cream Sandwich and Galaxy Nexus] out of respect, following the death of [[Steve Jobs]].{{cite web|title=Samsung Nexus Prime smartphone delay is 'Jobs tribute'|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-15236915&rct=j&sa=X&ei=ch6TTo_7I6TXiALi99zmCw&ved=0CDYQ-AsoATAA&q=nexus+prime&usg=AFQjCNExSHgoJsLA54a7k7mVGA7r6xYWjA&cad=rja|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=10 October 2011}} Before the official announcement, it was also referred to as the Google Nexus Prime among Android enthusiasts and the media.{{cite web|last=Topolsky |first=Joshua |url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/10/2552250/this-is-my-next-galaxy-nexus |title=This is my next: the Galaxy Nexus |publisher=The Verge |date=2011-11-10 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}{{cite web|url=http://gigaom.com/mobile/android-this-week-nexus-prime-launches-tablet-sales-data-android-4-0-arrives/ |title=Android this week: Nexus Prime launches; tablet sales data; Android 4.0 arrives â Mobile Technology News |publisher=Gigaom.com |date=2011-10-22 |accessdate=2011-11-22}} Before the unveiling, there had been repeated leaks of various details on the upcoming new Google phone.{{cite web|url= http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/06/samsung-galaxy-nexus-specs-leak-headed-to-verizon-as-an-exclusi|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus specs leak, headed to Verizon as an exclusive? (updated)|work=endgadget.com|author=Joseph Volpe |date=October 6, 2011}} Specifications on the phone varied including information about the processor and the camera. After the official unveiling some started to worry about the 5 megapixel camera but most of the fears were put to rest when photo and video samples were shown.{{cite web|url= http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZhlL-ys5iOA&feature=feedf|title=Video Sample}} The phone was announced on 19 October, 2011 in [[Hong Kong]],[http://www.brighthand.com/default.asp?newsID=18084&news=Google+OS+Android+Nexus+Prime+release+date Google Nexus Prime Set for October Launch]. Brighthand.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. revealing the official name as "Galaxy Nexus".[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/galaxy-nexus-ice-cream-sandwich-roundup-specs-details-and-ins/ Galaxy Nexus, Ice Cream Sandwich roundup: specs, details and insight, oh my!]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. == Hardware == The Galaxy Nexus features a 4.65-inch 1280Ã720-pixel HD [[Super AMOLED]] [[PenTile]]{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-has-curved-pentile-oled-display-21189996 |title=Galaxy Nexus has curved PenTile OLED display |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}} curved glass display, a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|TI OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9) with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540,[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]. Focus.ti.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. 1 GB of RAM. The processor can run from 1.2â1.5 GHz, but is underclocked at 1.2 GHz for consistent performance. Additionally, a 1,750 [[Ampere-hour|mAh]] battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera (with zero shutter lag) capable of [[1080p]] video,[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/samsung-galaxy-nexus-camera-and-1080p-video-samples/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus camera and 1080p video samples]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[barometer]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]] and it has 16 or 32 GB of internal memory. The Galaxy Nexus also hosts support for [[Mobile High-definition Link|MHL]] through the use of its [[Micro USB]] [[USB|2.0]] port.{{cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/20/behind-the-glass-a-detailed-tour-inside-the-samsung-galaxy-nexu/ |title=Behind the glass: a detailed tour inside the Samsung Galaxy Nexus |first=Brad |last=Molen |date=20 October 2011 |accessdate=24 October 2011 |work=Engadget}} This means that the Galaxy Nexus has the ability to output up to [[1080p]] [[audio-visual]] content (through [[HDMI]]) to any supported external display such as [[High-definition television|HD Television]].{{cite web |url=http://armdevices.net/2011/10/30/mhl-consortium-shows-some-of-the-latest-mhl-features/ |title=MHL Consortium shows some of the latest MHL features |date=30 October 2011 |accessdate=01 November 2011 |work=ARMdevices.net}} The Galaxy Nexus has no physical buttons on the front, but instead features on-screen [[soft key]]s embedded into the system software (part of Android 4.0). Beneath the soft keys, a multicolored notification [[Light-emitting diode|LED]] is featured, a feature missing from the [[Nexus S]].{{cite web |url=http://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_nexus_hands_on-review-663p2.php |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus hands-on: First look |date=19 October 2011 |accessdate=02 November 2011 |work=GSMArena.com}}{{cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-and-googles-ice-cream-sandwich-event-liveblog/ |title=Samsung and Google's Ice Cream Sandwich event liveblog! |first=Tim |last=Stevens |date=18 October 2011 ''---See '10.19PM' of event---'' |accessdate=02 November 2011 |work=Engadget}} The [[TRS connector|3.5 mm]] headphone [[jack (connector)|jack]] is located on the bottom of the phone, and the camera is located in the center of the rear side. The phone will have 16/32 GB internal storage depending on model.18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget == Software == [[File:Android 4.0.png|thumb|left|200px|[[Android (operating system)|Android]] 4.0, the operating system of the Galaxy Nexus]] Galaxy Nexus is the first device to run [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[List of Android operating system versions#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich]],Couts, Andrew. (2011-08-19) [http://news.yahoo.com/googles-nexus-prime-android-4-0-ice-cream-143600226.html Google's 'Nexus Prime' with Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich allegedly set for October release]. News.yahoo.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. introducing a large number of new features and improvements including, but not limited to, Face Unlock,[http://developer.android.com/sdk/android-4.0-highlights.html Android 4.0 Platform Highlights | Android Developers]. Developer.android.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/android-ice-cream-sandwich-adds-face-unlock-feature/ Android Ice Cream Sandwich adds Face Unlock feature]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. voice typing, Android Beam (using [[Near field communication|NFC]]),[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/google-announces-nfc-based-android-beam-for-sharing-between-phon/ Google announces NFC-based Android Beam for sharing between phones (video)]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. [[Wi-Fi Direct]] among others.{{cite web|url=http://developer.android.com/sdk/android-4.0-highlights.html |title=Android 4.0 Platform Highlights | Android Developers |publisher=Developer.android.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}} ==Availability== The phone is sold [[SIM lock|SIM-unlocked]][http://www.amazon.co.uk/Samsung-I9250-Galaxy-Nexus-Mobile/dp/B005XYU45E Samsung Galaxy Nexus 16GB Sim Free Smartphone: Amazon.co.uk: Electronics]. Amazon.co.uk. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.[http://www.expansys-usa.com/google-nexus-prime-android-smartphone-unlocked-16gb-224148/ Google Samsung Galaxy Nexus I9520 Android Smartphone (Unlocked, 16GB) #GT-i9520]. Expansys USA. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-gets-priced-sim-free-19189361/ |title=Galaxy Nexus gets priced SIM-free |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}} and hardware-unlocked (unlocked bootloader, allowing [[rooting (Android OS)|root access]]),{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/24/motorola-razr-open-for-unlocked-bootloader-business-if-the-carr/ |title=Motorola RAZR open for unlocked bootloader business, if the carrier says so |publisher=Engadget |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}{{cite web|url=http://www.handtec.co.uk/product.php/5527/samsung-galaxy-nexus-16gb--sim-free-unlocked- |title=Buy Samsung Galaxy Nexus 16GB (SIM Free/Unlocked) Reviews |publisher=Handtec.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/14/can-the-motorola-droid-razr-compete-with-the-galaxy-nexus/ |title=Can the Motorola Droid RAZR Compete with the Galaxy Nexus? |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-14 |accessdate=2011-10-27}}{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/18/motorola-droid-razr-shipping-with-locked-bootloader/ |title=Motorola Droid RAZR Shipping with Locked Bootloader |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-18 |accessdate=2011-10-27}} following the tradition of the Nexus phones: [[Nexus One]]{{cite web|author=K-Rivera |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/smartphones/htc-nexus-one-by/4505-6452_7-33906802.html |title=HTC Nexus One by Google Review â Watch CNET's Video Review |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}{{cite web|url=http://www.zdnet.com/blog/cell-phones/buying-the-nexus-one-unlocked-is-probably-the-best-choice/2879 |title=Buying the Nexus One unlocked is probably the best choice |publisher=ZDNet |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}} and [[Nexus S]].{{cite web|author=ghileman |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/smartphones/samsung-nexus-s-at/4505-6452_7-34431171.html |title=Samsung Nexus S Review â Watch CNET's Video Review |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}} ====Europe==== In the UK, the Galaxy Nexus was made available on [[O2 (UK)|O2]] and [[Hutchison 3G|Three]] on November 17, 2011 at a price of Â£499.99 and up. The version sold is the [[Evolved HSPA|HSPA+]] version.[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/27/amazon-outs-galaxy-nexus-release-date-available-in-the-uk-on-no/ Samsung makes Galaxy Nexus release date official, available in the UK on November 17th]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. Only the 16GB version of the phone will be available in the UK.[http://blog.three.co.uk/2011/10/19/galaxy-nexus-is-coming-to-three/ Galaxy Nexus is coming to Three. Â« Welcome to the Three Blog]. Blog.three.co.uk (2011-11-17). Retrieved on 2011-11-21.[http://blog.clove.co.uk/2011/10/19/samsung-galaxy-nexus-16gb-available-to-pre-order-at-clove-429-vat/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus (16GB) Available To Pre-Order at Clove, Â£429 + VAT Â« Clove Technologyâs Blog]. Blog.clove.co.uk (2011-10-19). Retrieved on 2011-11-21. The phone is expected to launch in 20 other European countries early december, 2011.[http://www.androidcentral.com/european-galaxy-nexus-availability European Galaxy Nexus availability]. Android Central (2011-10-28). Retrieved on 2011-11-21. ====North America==== In Canada, [[Bell Mobility]]{{cite web|url=http://www.bell.ca/Mobility/Products/Galaxy_Nexus|title=Galaxy Nexus page|work=Cell phone carrier product page|publisher=Bell Mobility}}, [[Wind Mobile]] and [[Virgin Mobile]] will launch the device December 8th, and [[Rogers Wireless]] and [[Telus]] have announced a January 2012 release.[http://www.androidpolice.com/2011/11/14/major-canadian-carriers-announce-impending-availability-of-galaxy-nexus/ Major Canadian Carriers Announce Impending Availability of Galaxy Nexus]. Androidpolice.com (2011-11-15). Retrieved on 2011-11-21. In the US, [[Verizon Wireless]] has announced that they will carry the LTE version of Galaxy Nexus, and it will be available by the end of 2011. Rumors have speculated that the handset will come to Verizon on December 8, but this has yet to have been confirmed.{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-confirmed-for-verizon-4g-lte-21190098/ |title=Galaxy Nexus confirmed for Verizon 4G LTE |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}} ====Asia-Pacific==== The phone will be supported by the carrier [[NTT DoCoMo]] in Japan, where the variant sold there will be known as the [[:ja:SC-04D|SC-04D]] within the [[:ja:docomo NEXT series|docomo NEXT series]] of smartphone devices. In India, the Galaxy Nexus is expected to launch by the end of 2011.[http://www.itpro.in/626770/galaxy-nexus-to-hit-indian-market-this-year-not-next Galaxy Nexus to hit Indian market this year not next | News | IT PRO India]. Itpro.in (2011-11-07). Retrieved on 2011-11-21. It is expected to be priced at around {{INR}}35,000.Makwana, Samir. (2011-11-08) [http://www.themobileindian.com/news/3687_Galaxy-Nexus-to-arrive-in-India-by-Mid-December Galaxy Nexus to arrive in India by Mid-December]. Themobileindian.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.[http://www.siliconindia.com/shownews/Galaxy_Nexus_to_Hit_India_by_MidDecember-nid-97097-cid-31.html Galaxy Nexus to Hit India by Mid-December]. Siliconindia.com (2011-11-09). Retrieved on 2011-11-21. ==Volume bug== A few days after the UK release, some users started noticing a glitch with the volume rocker, where the phone would lower the volume seemingly at random.{{cite web|url=http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=22021 |title=Issue 22021 - android - Volume down/mute on Galaxy Nexus running 4.0 - Android - An Open Handset Alliance Project - Google Project Hosting |publisher=Code.google.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/21/european-galaxy-nexus-owners-complain-of-erratic-volume-issue-v/ |title=European Galaxy Nexus owners complain of erratic volume issue (video) |publisher=Engadget |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}} [[Cnet|Cnet UK]] also reported that the phone in their review "dropped the volume when we were using [[2G]]. This means it was almost impossible to make calls over 2G. We missed calls and texts due to not hearing alerts." As a consequence, they could not recommend buying the phone at the time of the review.{{cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus review|url=http://reviews.cnet.co.uk/mobile-phones/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review-50005755/|publisher=Cnet (UK)|accessdate=22 November 2011}} On the 22 November 2011, the UK retailer [[Handtec]] temporarily stopped Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming that there was a problem with its stock of devices.{{cite web|url=http://www.handtec.co.uk/blog/2011/11/samsung-galaxy-nexus-shipping-update/ |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus â Shipping update | Handtec Blog |publisher=Handtec.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}{{cite web|last=Ziegler|first=Chris|title=Retailer Handtec stops Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming volume bug|url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/22/2580432/retailer-handtec-stops-galaxy-nexus-shipments-after-confirming-volume|work=11-22-2011|publisher=The Verge|accessdate=22 November 2011}} Soon after, on November 23, both Google and Samsung confirmed the issue, saying they already had a fix and the phones would be updated "as soon as possible"{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/23/google-responds-to-galaxy-nexus-volume-complaints-says-fix-is-i/ |title=Galaxy Nexus volume fix in the works, Google confirms |publisher=Engadget |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}{{cite web|url=http://www.androidpolice.com/2011/11/23/google-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-is-not-hardware-related-software-fix-already-on-the-way/ |title=Google: Galaxy Nexus Volume Bug Is Fixable In Software - Fix Already On The Way |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}{{cite web|author=Mikael Ricknäs |url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9222128/Samsung_to_issue_fix_for_Galaxy_Nexus_volume_issue |title=Samsung to issue fix for Galaxy Nexus volume issue |publisher=Computerworld |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}. On November 28th, what apparently is the fix produced by Google leaked on the internet.http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/28/galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-fix-gets-early-release-official-testing/http://techcrunch.com/2011/11/28/having-galaxy-nexus-volume-woes-download-the-fix-now/http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-fix-released-28198255/. On the 29, November, Handtec resumed shipping of the Galaxy Nexus.http://www.handtec.co.uk/blog/2011/11/samsung-galaxy-nexus-shipping-update/ On November 30 Google started updating devices, stating "We're currently rolling out a fix for the volume issue which will reach everyone in the coming week."http://www.theinquirer.net/inquirer/news/2128965/samsung-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-fix-rollinghttp://www.theverge.com/2011/11/29/2599218/google-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-fix-will-be-rolled-out-in-the-coming/in/2343007 This has fixed the volume bug for Galaxy Nexus smartphones. == Reception == The Galaxy Nexus is a highly anticipated phone,{{cite web|last=Webster |first=Scott |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/8301-19736_7-20116674-251/leaked-galaxy-nexus-details-point-to-verizon-exclusivity/ |title=Leaked Galaxy Nexus details point to Verizon exclusivity | Android Atlas â CNET Reviews |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/ice-cream-sandwich-debuted-with-samsung-galaxy-nexus/2011/10/19/gIQALxeM0L_story.html |title=Ice Cream Sandwich debuted with Samsung Galaxy Nexus |publisher=The Washington Post |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5850411/rumor-galaxy-nexus-coming-to-verizon-november-10th-for-an-ouchie-300 |title=Rumor: Galaxy Nexus Coming to Verizon November 10th for an Ouchie $300 |publisher=Gizmodo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}{{cite web |url=http://newyork.ibtimes.com/articles/232581/20111017/galaxy-nexus-prime-ice-cream-sandwich-android.htm |title=Galaxy Nexus Prime & Ice Cream Sandwich Release, Price Leaked (video) |work=International Business Times |publisher=Newyork.ibtimes.com |date=2011-10-17 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}{{cite web |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/technology/2011/10/galaxy-nexus-release-uk.html |title=Galaxy Nexus releasing Nov. 17 â in the U.K. |last=Olivarez-Giles |first=Nathan |work=Los Angeles Times |date=October 28, 2011 |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |accessdate=2011-10-30}}{{cite web|last=Zeman |first=Eric |url=http://www.informationweek.com/news/personal-tech/smart-phones/231900194 |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus: High-End Specs â Personal-tech â Smart Phones |publisher=Informationweek |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}} even regarded as the most anticipated Android device of 2011,[http://androidandme.com/2011/11/devices/the-samsung-galaxy-nexus-and-the-launch-that-could-have-been/ The Samsung Galaxy Nexus and the launch that could have been]. Android and Me. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.[http://mobilesyrup.com/2011/11/17/galaxy-nexus-review-part-1-hardware-overview-video/ Galaxy Nexus Review Part 1: Hardware Overview (Video)]. MobileSyrup.com (2011-11-17). Retrieved on 2011-11-21.[http://cmvlive.com/technology/gadgets/the-samsung-galaxy-nexus-offers-super-camera-quality The Samsung Galaxy Nexus Offers Super Camera Quality]. Cmvlive.com (2011-11-14). Retrieved on 2011-11-21.[http://www.mobiledia.com/news/116958.html Samsung Releases Galaxy Nexus in U.K., to Launch in U.S.]. Mobiledia. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.[http://www.themobilelinks.com/Samsung/the-samsung-galaxy-nexus-and-the-launch-that-could-have-been-/ The Samsung Galaxy Nexus and the launch that could have been]. The Mobile Links. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.[http://www.androidguys.com/2011/11/14/bell-canada-officially-announces-galaxy-nexus/ Bell Canada Officially Announces Galaxy Nexus AndroidGuys]. Androidguys.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. gathering very positive reviews.[http://blogs.computerworld.com/19297/galaxy_nexus_review_roundup_lte_release_date_confirmed Galaxy Nexus review roundup, LTE release date Monday? â Computerworld Blogs]. Blogs.computerworld.com (2011-11-17). Retrieved on 2011-11-21. According to [[Engadget]] editor Darren Murph, the Galaxy Nexus was "smooth as ever. Without question, this is easily the slickest, most polished version of Android yet"[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-ice-cream-sandwich-android-4-0-a-hands-on-screenshot-g/ Google Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0): a hands-on screenshot gallery]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. and that "The entire experience just felt polished. In a way, it's as if Android's growing a bit and maturing before our eyes", concluding with "Overall, we're thrilled with how the first [[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|ICS]] handset has turned out. It's understated, sleek, beautiful and packs a display that's destined to drop jaws."[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on (video)]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. In their official review of the Galaxy Nexus (HSPA+ variant) Engadget editor Myriam Joire concluded that "The Galaxy Nexus is definitely the best Android phone available today -- it's possibly even the best phone available today, period", praising it for its speed, feel, display and battery life. However, she did note that the camera was "underwhelming" and that the build quality was average.http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/24/galaxy-nexus-hspa-review/ In a [[T3 (magazine)|T3]] review Thomas Tamblyn noted the camera was "quicker than many digital cameras" and concluded saying "the whole experience is very fluid. Even in its current form [a pre-release version] It feels like a version of Android that is already very polished."{{cite web|author=Updated 18:31 26 Oct 2011 by Thomas Tamblyn |url=http://www.t3.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus review: Hands on |publisher=T3 |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}} The GSMArena review concludes stating "The Galaxy Nexus is an impressive device on its own."{{cite web|url=http://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_nexus_hands_on-review-663p4.php |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus hands-on: First look |publisher=GSMArena.com |date=2011-10-19 |accessdate=2011-10-30}} Mobilesyrup's review indicates "From our time with the device, we can safely say there is no going back. Every piece of Android hardware from this day on will be judged not on the speed of its processor or its pixel density but on whether it is running Ice Cream Sandwich. The Galaxy Nexus has a market lead so vast as to be a chasm; the experience is just that much better. [...] Samsung has wisely taken the best design aspects of the Nexus S and Galaxy S II variants and created the first best Android device ever."{{cite web|url=http://mobilesyrup.com/2011/11/17/galaxy-nexus-review-part-1-hardware-overview-video/|title=Galaxy Nexus Review Part 1: Hardware Overview (video)|publisher=mobilesyrup.com|date=2011-11-17|accessdate=2011-11-17}} Charlie White, at [[Mashable]], described the screen as "gorgeous", offering "an exquisitely sharp view", and describing the hardware design as "a spectacular success", concluding "The Samsung Galaxy Nexus is by far the best Android phone Iâve seen yet."[http://mashable.com/2011/11/17/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus Review]. Mashable.com (2011-11-17). Retrieved on 2011-11-21. Joshua Topolsky from [[The Verge]] stated "It's one of the best smartphones ever made, and with a couple of minor tweaks (particularly to the camera), it could be the best smartphone ever produced."Newman, Jared. (2011-11-17) [http://www.pcworld.com/article/244225/galaxy_nexus_reviews_of_course_its_the_best_android.html Galaxy Nexus Reviews: Of Course It's the Best Android]. PCWorld. Retrieved on 2011-11-21. Vincent Nguyen, from [[SlashGear]] noted the fast performance of Android 4.0.1, the tight integration between the operating system and the hardware and concluded that "this is the best Android phone around today".{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-review-21196912/ |title=Galaxy Nexus Review |publisher=SlashGear |date=2006-10-27 |accessdate=2011-11-22}} JR Raphael, from [[Computerworld]], stated "The Galaxy Nexus [...] is an exceptional phone, arguably the finest Android handset to date.", concluding "The Galaxy Nexus is sleek and attractive, with a thin, light body and a beautiful HD display. It's screamingly fast, too, delivering what may be the best overall performance of any mobile device available." == See also == * [[List of Android devices]] * [[Comparison of smartphones]] {{clear}} == References == {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== * {{Official website|www.google.com/nexus}} * [http://www.samsung.com/uk/consumer/mobile-devices/smartphones/android/GT-I9250TSAXEU Galaxy Nexus at Samsung] * [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ts5WBm0tXzI Official announcement video] * [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/galaxy-nexus-ice-cream-sandwich-roundup-specs-details-and-ins/ Engadget coverage] * [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a-AAZyyOrzs Video: What is new and improved over [[Nexus S]]] {{Android}} {{Android devices}} {{Google Inc.}} [[Category:2011 introductions]] [[Category:Android devices]] [[Category:Google]] [[Category:Smartphones]] [[Category:Samsung mobile phones]] [[ar:Ø¬Ø§ÙØ§ÙØ³Ù ÙÙØ³Ø³]] [[ca:Galaxy Nexus]] [[de:Galaxy Nexus]] [[es:Galaxy Nexus]] [[fa:Ú¯Ø§ÙÚ©Ø³Û ÙÚ©Ø³ÙØ³]] [[fr:Galaxy Nexus]] [[ko:ê°¤ë­ì ë¥ìì¤]] [[it:Galaxy Nexus]] [[ja:SC-04D]] [[pl:Galaxy Nexus]] [[pt:Galaxy Nexus]] [[ru:Galaxy Nexus]] [[simple:Galaxy Nexus]] [[sv:Galaxy Nexus]] [[zh:Galaxy Nexus]]
